title: Weight

properties.name: description
properties.value: Every item in Old School RuneScape has weight, which can affect a user in their gameplay. Players can see the total weight of the items they have equipped (measured in kilograms) or are carrying in their inventory on the Equipment Stats screen. Many items weigh with decimals, but the Equipment Stats screen will round down to the nearest kilogram. For example, a rune platebody weighs 9.979 kg, but will be displayed as 9 kg.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Weight
"kg" redirects here. For the item suffix, see (kg).

Every item in Old School RuneScape has weight, which can affect a user in their gameplay. Players can see the total weight of the items they have equipped (measured in kilograms) or are carrying in their inventory on the Equipment Stats screen. Many items weigh with decimals, but the Equipment Stats screen will round down to the nearest kilogram. For example, a rune platebody weighs 9.979 kg, but will be displayed as 9 kg.

The rate at which energy depletes while running scales linearly between 0 kg and 64 kg weight, where having 0 kg weight will deplete a player's run energy at the normal rate and having 64 kg weight will deplete a player's run energy at exactly twice the normal rate. Having a weight outside the range of 0 kg to 64 kg has no additional effect.[1] A player's Agility level contributes to how quickly run energy is restored, but does not affect the rate at which a player's run energy is depleted.

Some activities in Old School RuneScape require players to not weigh more than a certain amount. Example: diving off Port Khazard during and after Recipe for Disaster (Freeing Pirate Pete subquest); walking on the bridge in Temple of Ikov.

Stackable items such as runes, coins, and other items do not have a weight. Some items also reduce weight instead of adding, which is very useful for quests or activities that require a lot of running.

Contents

  • 1 Weight reducing items
  • 2 Greatest weight
  • 3 Weighing
  • 4 Trivia
  • 5 References

Weight reducing items[edit | edit source]

Item Weight (kg)
Spotted cape -2.267
Spottier cape -4.535
Agility cape -4.0
Boots of lightness -4.535
Penance gloves -4.535
Graceful hood -3.0
Graceful top -5.0
Graceful cape -4.0
Graceful legs -6.0
Graceful gloves -3.0
Graceful boots -4.0
Pufferfish -0.5

Currently, wearing the combination of a spottier cape, boots of lightness, penance gloves, graceful hood, graceful top and graceful legs allows the player to have weight as low as -27.605 kg; With a full inventory of pufferfish this is lowered to -41.605 kg, this is the minimum amount of weight currently possible. All weight reducing items are wearables and have to be worn to 'activate' the weight reduction, with the exception of pufferfish.

Greatest weight[edit | edit source]

The current greatest weight possible a player can weigh at any given time is 1,024.525 kg. Items required to wear in order to reach this weight are:

Slot Item Weight (kg)
Headwear Gold helmet 31.751
Cape Diving apparatus 10
Neckwear Seal of passage 4.535
Ammunition God blessings 0.51
Weapon Barrelchest anchor/Dinh's bulwark 30[d 1]
Shield - 0
Body Granite body 22.679
Legs Granite legs 15.875
Hands Skeletal gloves/Spined gloves 3.175
Boots Guardian boots 7
Ring Granite ring (i)/Granite ring 3
Inventory 28× Barrel of coal tar (or any variation) 28×32 (896)
Total 1,024.525
  1. ^ The Barrelchest anchor and Dinh's bulwark are two-handed weapons, therefore the Shield slot will be empty. They can also be substituted with Crate with zanik. It weighs 2 kg more, making the absolute maximum possible weight 1,026.525, but is only available during Death to the Dorgeshuun.

Weighing[edit | edit source]

Since some items' weights which have fractions are rounded off in the Equipment Stats screen, it's hard to tell the real weight. However, there are some weights to help find out the precise weight of an item.

Item 1 Item 2 Weight (kg)
Bones Bread 0.500
Shrimps Cake tin 0.100
Tomato Burnt shrimp 0.080
Vial of water(m) Egg 0.020
Brass key Lockpick(m) 0.010
Wool Uncut sapphire 0.003
Mith grapple(m) Al kharid flyer 0.001

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • In RuneScript, the game's compiler accepts other units of measuring weight, using pounds (lb), ounces (oz) and grams (g).[2] Many items are assigned weights in different units within RuneScript, but are automatically converted to kilograms in-game. For example, the gold helmet is assigned a weight of 70 lbs, but it is converted to 31.751 kg in-game.
    • In addition, stackable items also have assigned weights, but they are overridden by the game's code to be 0 kg. For example, coins have an assigned weight of 2 grams (0.002 kg).

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Old School RuneScape. "Runescape Mythbusters Special - Ep. 2." (49:35), YouTube video. 1 April 2015.
  2. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 24 February 2015. (Archived from the original on 1 July 2020.) Mod Ash: "The compiler accepts definitions in lb, oz, g and kg. I've no idea why Andrew was so flexible with that."

{{external|rs}}
{{Redirect2|kg|the item suffix|(kg)}}
[[File:Weight icon.png|left]]
Every item in ''Old School RuneScape'' has '''weight''', which can affect a user in their gameplay. Players can see the total weight of the items they have [[equipment|equipped]] (measured in kilograms) or are carrying in their [[inventory]] on the [[Equipment Stats]] screen. Many items weigh with decimals, but the Equipment Stats screen will round down to the nearest kilogram. For example, a [[rune platebody]] weighs 9.979 kg, but will be displayed as 9 kg.

The rate at which energy depletes while [[run]]ning scales linearly between 0 kg and 64 kg weight, where having 0 kg weight will deplete a player's [[energy|run energy]] at the normal rate and having 64 kg weight will deplete a player's run energy at exactly twice the normal rate. Having a weight outside the range of 0 kg to 64 kg has no additional effect.{{CiteVideo|author=Old School RuneScape|title=Runescape Mythbusters Special - Ep. 2|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ggO8ARYEB-w&t=2975|timestamp=49:35|date=1 April 2015|site=YouTube|notes=|name=Ian Gower}} A player's [[Agility]] level contributes to how quickly run energy is restored, but does not affect the rate at which a player's run energy is depleted.

Some activities in ''Old School RuneScape'' require players to not weigh more than a certain amount. Example: diving off [[Port Khazard]] during and after [[Recipe for Disaster]] ([[Freeing Pirate Pete]] subquest); walking on the bridge in [[Temple of Ikov]].

[[Stackable items]] such as runes, coins, and other items do not have a weight. Some items also reduce weight instead of adding, which is very useful for quests or activities that require a lot of running.

Currently, wearing the combination of a spottier cape, boots of lightness, penance gloves, graceful hood, graceful top and graceful legs allows the player to have weight as low as -27.605 kg; With a full inventory of pufferfish this is lowered to -41.605 kg, this is the minimum amount of weight currently possible. All weight reducing items are wearables and have to be worn to 'activate' the weight reduction, with the exception of [[pufferfish]].

==Greatest weight==
The current greatest weight possible a player can weigh at any given time is 1,024.525 kg. Items required to wear in order to reach this weight are:

==Trivia==
*In [[RuneScript]], the game's compiler accepts other units of measuring weight, using pounds (lb), ounces (oz) and grams (g).{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url= https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/570235510691487744|date=24 February 2015|archiveurl=https://archive.vn/3nMop|archivedate=1 July 2020|quote=The compiler accepts definitions in lb, oz, g and kg. I've no idea why Andrew was so flexible with that.}} Many items are assigned weights in different units within RuneScript, but are automatically converted to kilograms in-game. For example, the [[gold helmet]] is assigned a weight of 70 lbs, but it is converted to 31.751 kg in-game.
**In addition, [[stackable items]] also have assigned weights, but they are overridden by the game's code to be 0 kg. For example, [[coins]] have an assigned weight of 2 grams (0.002 kg).
